column1: 軍配糸蜻蛉 (ぐんばいいととんぼ) ‎(gunbai ito tonbo): a type of damselfly, Platycnemis foliacea sasakii  軍配団扇 (ぐんばいうちわ) ‎(gunbai uchiwa): a lacquered rigid wooden fan used for signaling  軍配者 (ぐんばいしゃ) ‎(gunbaisha): a person issuing commands to a military force: a commander  軍配凧 (ぐんばいだこ) ‎(gunbaidako): a kite in the shape of a gunbai uchiwa  軍配蜻蛉 (ぐんばいとんぼ) ‎(gunbai tonbo): a type of damselfly, Platycnemis foliacea sasakii  軍配薺 (ぐんばいなずな) ‎(gunbai nazuna): the field pennycress, Thlaspi arvense  軍配昼顔 (ぐんばいひるがお) ‎(gunbai hirugao): the beach morning glory or goat's foot, a common tropical creeping vine: Ipomoea pes-caprae  軍配酸漿 (ぐんばいほおずき) ‎(gunbai hōzuki): the egg sac of marine whelks of family Melongenidae  軍配虫 (ぐんばいむし) ‎(gunbai mushi): common name for a lace bug, flying insects of family Tingidae

軍配 (ぐんばい)を上 (あ)げる ‎(gunbai o ageru): “to raise the gunbai (uchiwa)” → to decide in favor of someone, such as in a competition (from the way the gyōji or sumo referee raises the gunbai uchiwa to indicate a win)  軍配 (ぐんばい)を返 (かえ)す ‎(gunbai o kaesu): “to turn over the gunbai (uchiwa)” → to signal the start of a sumo match, once the initial start-up positioning time has run out
